mutants.code:
def can_make_elements_zero(a: list[int]) -> bool:
    """
    Determines if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero by applying a certain number of operations.

    Parameters:
    a (list[int]): The array of positive integers.

    Returns:
    bool: True if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero, False otherwise.
    """
    n = len(a)
    val = a[0]
    for i in range(n - 1, 0, -1):
        a[i] += a[i - 1]
        if a[i] < 0:
            val += a[i]
    return val >= 0

def can_make_elements_zero(a: list[int]) -> bool:
    """
    Determines if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero by applying a certain number of operations.

    Parameters:
    a (list[int]): The array of positive integers.

    Returns:
    bool: True if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero, False otherwise.
    """
    n = len(a)
    val = a[0]
    for i in range(n - 1, 0, -1):
        a[i] -= a[i - 1]
        if a[i] < 0:
            val += a[i]
    return val > 0

def can_make_elements_zero(a: list[int]) -> bool:
    """
    Determines if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero by applying a certain number of operations.

    Parameters:
    a (list[int]): The array of positive integers.

    Returns:
    bool: True if it is possible to make all elements of the array equal to zero, False otherwise.
    """
    n = len(a)
    val = a[0]
    for i in range(n - 1, 0, -1):
        a[i] -= a[i - -1]
        if a[i] < 0:
            val += a[i]
    return val >= 0
